results.title: Histoire D'adrien = Story of Adrien
results.brief_description:
Adrien, an illegitimate child, must endure the nastiness of those around him. Only his grandmother gives him love and understanding. After her death, the young boy finds a job as a flour-mill worker. Adrien witnesses the changes in country life as machines take on the jobs of several men. Adrien grows up and becomes a railway worker and falls in love with a laundress, Marguerite. But her parents to do not look favourably on their daughter marrying a poor man. In order to evoke the memory of country life in the South of France at the turn of the 20th Century, Jean-Pierre Denis delved into the collective memory of actors and locals who spoke exclusively in Occitan. This gave a great authenticity to the depiction (or painting, as certain scenes are filmed to resemble works by Georges de la Tour) of rural life and contributed to ascertain that an original, local culture had survived successive waves of modernisation and mechanisation. In parallel, the film shows the first sketches of an other world: the world of factory workers with its struggles, strikes and energy. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1980: Camera D’Or for Debut Feature Film.

Credits: Director, Jean-Pierre Denis ; writers, Francoise Dudognon, Jean-Pierre Denis ; photography, Denis Gheerbrant ; music, Joan Pao Verdier.
Cast: Bertrand Sautereau, Serge Dominique, Pierre Dieuaide, Marcelle Dessales, Odette Peytoureau.

results.title: His Majesty
results.brief_description: Animated film about a king losing his temper. Suddenly we see that the king is only a chess piece on a board and he becomes meek.

results.title: Hiroshima: blast effect, April 1946 [Silent]
results.creator_credit: United States. National Archives and Records Service
results.brief_description: Filmed eight months after the dropping of the first atomic bomb. Shows the extent of the devastation caused by the bomb. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Hillary ventures south
results.brief_description: A documentary chronicling a visit to Tasmania by Sir Edmund Hillary. He arrives, meets some dignitaries, surveys some national park areas to the south of Hobart, then joins a bushwalking club to scale Mount Mawson. The film focusses on what a thrill it is for these youngsters to climb alonside the man who scaled Everest. Hillary, the narrator tells us, says Tasmania has some of the greatest tramping country in the world.

results.title: Highfire: plan for survival
results.creator_credit: Bruce Kerner, William Brose and William Brose Productions
results.brief_description: Fire in high-rise buildings is a possibility that cannot be overlooked. This film is designed for all levels of employees and management in multi-storey buildings, and is a motivational film, demanding the viewer’s response to their own fire safety program.

results.title: High pressure drums
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the manufacture of high pressure boiler drums in one of Britain’s leading engineering works. Scenes of the installation of drums during the construction of a new atomic power plant show one of the many fields of industry in which this article is an essential component.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.
